image.altText: Two women stand waist deep in water at a beach.

props.synopsis: People are warned against swimming at many of Hobart's beaches after industrial waste from the Cadbury chocolate factory takes a treatment plant offline, leading to untreated sewage flowing into the River Derwent.

title.children: Hobart beaches contaminated after Cadbury chocolate factory knocks out sewage plant

image.altText: A woman wearing a blue cardigan and a young toddler wearing a brown dress sit on a couch in a sun-filled lounge room.

props.synopsis: More Tasmanian families are travelling interstate to access publicly funded IVF services, something that's not available to them at home.

title.children: 'It's really unfair': Calls for publicly funded IVF services in Tasmania

image.altText: Pokies

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government shelved its nation-leading pokies reforms due to "significant cost increases and implementation delays". A redacted report used to justify that decision omits what those costs are.

title.children: Report used to justify dropping nation-leading pokies reforms redacts key figure

image.altText: A man in a black t-shirt stares out into the distance.

props.synopsis: King Island's faced some tough times lately, with its iconic dairy set to close, a drought, and uncertainty over its mine's future. So, what does this mean for young people who call the island home?

title.children: King Island Dairy's closure has island's young locals facing uncertain future

image.altText: A young woman with long blonde hair smiles, sitting on the ground surrounded by pots of colourful flowers.

props.synopsis: Jasmine Waddington had envisioned her life revolving around sports before a medical condition greatly restricted her physical abilities at the age of 15. But she's found a new career path, thanks to her grandmother.

title.children: Woman discovers pigface passion after life 'completely changed' by POTS diagnosis

image.altText: Sally Catherall standing in her front yard.

props.synopsis: The ABC speaks to those who took alternative and complementary medicines after a cancer diagnosis and asks how they navigated their beliefs.

title.children: Cancer patient told she wasn't 'positive enough' when turmeric didn't work

image.altText: Three children: JayBird Byrne, Lani and Luca.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australian kids experience 'school can't'. For these families, finding a system that works has transformed their child's life.

title.children: Did you miss? 📣 'Unschooling' kids are thriving after leaving the classroom

image.altText: A person wearing a black cloak and hood with a beak sits on a hill, in front of a blue sky and desert outlook

props.synopsis: While many Australians await the arrival of Santa Claus, kids in outback Australia are celebrating with their own unique Christmas icon.

title.children: He's mysterious, scary and feathered — and he brings presents to outback kids

image.altText: Severely damaged front of bus after collision with a truck on the Hume Highway

props.synopsis: The Hume Highway is closed to northbound traffic, with Live Traffic NSW saying it is not expected to open for some time while police conduct their investigations.

title.children: Bus driver dies, 39 passengers taken to hospital as bus and truck crash closes Hume Highway

image.altText: capitol hill building in washington dc in the background with a red stop sign in the foreground

props.synopsis: The president-elect had pressured Congress to tie up loose ends before he takes office on January 20, but members of the Republican Party's right flank refused to support the package.

title.children: Trump-backed spending deal fails as government shutdown fast approaches

image.altText: composite of banks,, a wanted poster and Kym Parsons over a map of the locations hit

props.synopsis: Over 10 years, the notorious "bicycle bandit" terrorised innocent bank tellers at gunpoint. His identity remained a mystery for almost two decades until police used a game changing forensic technique to unmask the culprit.

title.children: Unmasking the bicycle bandit: How cops caught the notorious armed robber

image.altText: Packets of Codral and Sudafed opened

props.synopsis: A Brisbane law firm has filed a class action against Johnson & Johnson alleging the pharmaceutical giant made false claims about the effectiveness of popular brands of cold and flu medication.

title.children: Class action filed against Johnson & Johnson over 'ineffective' flu medication

image.altText: A close-up of Fauziah Basyriah in a florally patterned Hijab, looking sorrowfully at the camera.

props.synopsis: The Boxing Day tsunami interrupted a civil war, triggered the worst rail accident in history and shattered the lives of millions. Twenty years on, those who escaped certain death share their stories.

title.children: A disaster so big it sped up our planet's rotation. Its impacts are still felt today

image.altText: Two medication boxes, one resting on top of the other.

props.synopsis: There's growing concern about how people stop taking antidepressant medication, particularly if they have been on it for a long time. Researchers say the process needs to be slowed down.

title.children: Growing alarm about how people come off antidepressants 'too quickly'

image.altText: An image of Scott Rush, Matthew Norman, Chen Si-Yi, Martin Stephens, and Michael Czugaj

props.synopsis: The five members of the group left Darwin on Thursday night and have touched down in Brisbane, Sydney and Melbourne on Friday morning greeted by family members and supporters at the airports.

title.children: Freed Bali Nine members reunited with families for first time in almost 20 years

image.altText: A thick plume of smoke and red hazy sky

props.synopsis: More residents in the state's west under "leave immediately" warnings as hundreds of firefighters battle a blaze that has grown to 28,000 hectares.

title.children: Halls Gap under threat as Grampians bushfire grows, others test firefighters

image.altText: a graphic of black and white photos including a newspaper clipping and photo of Phillip Lamont

props.synopsis: Although police were confident they had caught the Ether Man, no charges were ever laid.

title.children: 'You've got me, charge me': The lucky break that helped police catch a serial Brisbane rapist

image.altText: A composite image of three logos consisting of coles, woolworths and aldi

props.synopsis: The ACCC's supermarket inquiry has shone a spotlight on Coles and Woolworths' high prices. But 76 per cent of shoppers still head to either store for their primary grocery shop.

title.children: The loyalty tax shoppers willingly pay despite push for supermarket competition

image.altText: Senator Matt Canavan. June 22, 2021

props.synopsis: Nationals senator Matthew Canavan has said in an interview that his party introduced a nuclear policy as a political fix, in a video that emerges amid his colleague Keith Pitt announcing he will quit politics.

title.children: Nationals senator claims Coalition introduced nuclear as a political fix

image.altText: Australia celebrates the final wicket, the umpire standing with his finger in the air

props.synopsis: Dehydration, a double century, and disputed decisions. The 1986 Tied Test between India and Australia was one of the most dramatic cricket matches in the sport's history.

title.children: Dehydration, a double century, and disputed decisions of the 1986 Tied Test

image.altText: A man with beard speaks calmly at a mosque.

props.synopsis: Ahmed al-Sharaa, also known as Abu Mohammed al-Golani, is the leader of the Islamist group Hayat Tahrir al-Sham that led a push to oust Bashar al-Assad from power.

title.children: US drops $16m reward for arrest of Syria's new leader amid 'positive messages'

image.altText: Raygun posted a video on her Instagram account last night to announce the matter had been resolved.

props.synopsis: Raygun, of Paris Olympic fame, says the legal dispute with comedian Steph Broadbridge is over and no legal fees will be sought.

title.children: Raygun says parody musical legal drama has been resolved

image.altText: Commuters walk past trains and a timetable at Sydney's Central railway station

props.synopsis: A snowball effect of work bans on the Sydney train network is expected from Saturday onwards, with more than 200 bans notified from the combined rail unions.

title.children: Sydney commuters brace for worsening train services this weekend

image.altText: LeBron James dribbles the ball against Sacremento Kings.

props.synopsis: In the midst of his 22nd season, LeBron James claims another NBA milestone as he helps Los Angeles Lakers defeat Sacramento Kings 113-100.

title.children: LeBron James breaks Kareem Abdul-Jabbar's 35-year-old NBA record

image.altText: A woman is on a jet ski in flood waters and a truck that's covered in water is next to her.

props.synopsis: All of the nine people who have caused a fatality after driving into southern Queensland floodwater since 2021 have been men.

title.children: Statistics show experienced male drivers most likely to die on flooded roads

image.altText: A Malaysian Airlines Boeing 777 plane takes off from Kuala Lumpur airport.

props.synopsis: The search will be on the seabed of a new area covering 15,000 square kilometres.

title.children: Malaysia to resume search for MH370 — 10 years after it vanished

image.altText: An edited image showing Nazim Dastan and Cihan Bilgin

props.synopsis: Journalists Nazim Dastan and Cihan Bilgin were killed east of Aleppo, after their car was reportedly hit by a Turkish drone, the Dicle Firat Journalists' Association said.

title.children: Two journalists killed in north Syria by 'Turkish drone'

image.altText: An antechinus nibbles at a human finger

props.synopsis: Scientists are fortifying a national park at the southern tip of Australia's mainland to keep invasive predators away from endangered native plants and animals.

title.children: Countless animals could be saved from extinction thanks to this national park

image.altText: A close up of a Christmas tree with people seen socialising in the background

props.synopsis: So much of what we hope and expect from Christmas is performative, and springs from the presentation of a perfect family holiday that inevitably is unattainable. It's hard to pick the fake when everyone is so desperately in search of the real.

title.children: Christmas has never been my day. This year, it might be

image.altText: A man, holding a baby, and a woman, walking away from a damaged street with a fire burning in the background.

props.synopsis: Portugal has strongly condemned a Russian strike on Kyiv which damaged a building that housed its embassy and the offices of several other countries.

title.children: Multiple embassies in Kyiv damaged in Russian drone, missile strikes

image.altText: People cross the road at an intersection in a busy CBD, March 2021

props.synopsis: The latest population projections show capital cities growing twice as fast as everywhere else, led by the largest.

title.children: Australians to vote with feet for crowded city life, Treasury predicts

image.altText: A woman wearing a sari and sunglasses smiles while shaking hands with a man in Indian attire

props.synopsis: Muslim-majority Bangladesh and Hindu-majority India enjoyed close relations for decades. That changed in 2024.

title.children: A political 'husband-wife' relationship has ended badly in South Asia

image.altText: A man in fishing clothes holds a huge fish, water in the background

props.synopsis: Anglers are reeling in plenty of barramundi from a Queensland dam that could lose some prized stock if more rain forces it to spill.

title.children: 'Unreal' conditions as fishers race against time to catch huge barramundi

image.altText: a young man on a row boat

props.synopsis: Tom Robinson's record setting adventure across the Pacific changed him forever. Now he's hoping to inspire other young Australians to follow their dreams.

title.children: Inside adventurer Tom Robinson's incredible solo row across the Pacific

image.altText: Michael Leunig talks about his cartoon, Musings from the Inner Duck.

props.synopsis: Michael Leunig is remembered by some of Australia's best-known cartoonists as an artist who changed political cartooning forever and left an indelible mark on our cultural landscape.

title.children: 'End of an era': Australian cartoonists reflect on Leunig's work and life
